They'd admittedly love to keep saying, ad nauseum, "We got this," but the reality at this point is that they’re going to be shy of being able to afford the final push.EU's first group of farmers and chefs are excited for the first official route day. With the growing season coming on strong, the truck only needs insulation installed and a few fine tunings, which are actively being addressed. The real struggle left in getting EU off the ground is the ability to pay farmers up-front and to be able to do so for up to 30 days as individual billing cycles are paid and cash flow begins.EU's business model is based around reliability, consistency, and building relationships over time; running out of funds in the infant stages of operation would put pressure on each of these aspects. Still, the fact remains that peak growing season is now, and it's time to roll. Want to help, but money is tight?To say that Hugh and Aaron get where you're coming from would be an understatement. Sometimes it's trying enough just to keep the bills paid and the fridge stocked. And then, as if that's not enough, some random friends of yours are asking for money to fund the last stage of setting up their business. Well, they want you to know that it's not all about financial support.Encouraging words and well-wishes have meant and continue to mean a lot as EU moves forward, and it doesn't stop there. Every friend that helps spread the word around is doing a huge favor. Sharing is caring, after all. If anyone comes across this page via a share or a like, and ends up donating just $5, a difference has been made.Stretch GoalsThe funding goal for this campaign is right where it needs to be to accomplish the specific task outlined above: paying farmers for produce throughout initial billing cycles. That said, this is a new business and every cent can be put to use. Any funds over the campaign goal will be used towards the completion of the online store. EU is in the initial stages of developing a web-store and app to allow customers to see and order from the ever-changing inventory with ease. Additional funding will speed this project along.

story:
Summary

I am Dudley 'Tal' Stokes, founding member of the Jamaican Bobsled Team, a 4 time Olympian, and the subject of the Disney Feature Length Film Cool Runnings. I am also the author of the motivational memoir 'Advice I should have taken (and other things I think I have learnt)'.

 

Most importantly, I am husband to my wife of 31 years, Denise, and father to our three wonderful children, Christian, Teressa and Michael,

 

 

For the past two years we (denise and dudley or dnd) have been Airbnb hosts on the majestic Caribbean Island of Providenciales in the Turks and Caicos. We have hosted over 200 guests from Around the World

 

(Black, White, Indian, Chinese, Latinos, Europeans, Turks, Arabs, people from the LGBT community, Trump supporters, Clinton supporters, students, professors, hairdressers, retirees, recovering cancer survivors and newly weds).

We can tell you that the experience of hosting so many diverse guests has been profound, and the joy it has brought to our family is immeasurable. It has made us true believers in the "sharing economy," and in the notion that as humans, we are all neighbors.

In return, we believe that we have given our guests an authentic Caribbean experience. We have a feeling that everybody leaves our residence a little more relaxed and rejuvenated than when they arrived.

 

We now have a unique opportunity to increase our ability to host, share, learn and love. We sincerely hope you will consider helping us achieve this goal.

What We Need

Villa Billa is a custom residence on Grace Bay that was initially purposed as a Yoga retreat by a very special couple. It is absolutely stunning!

 

The architecturally inspired 'pod' design includes  four bedrooms, each with an ensuite bathroom, a spacious verandah, and breathtaking views of Grace Bay Beach, which is so often named The World's Most Beautiful Beach by TripAdvisor.

 

The couple are selling Villa Billa, and Denise and I wish to take it over and continue our mission of hosting diverse and interesting people from around the world.

 

We need $75,000 for

$63,000       balance on deposit

$ 4,000        legal cost

$ 3,750        platform fee

$  4,250       contingencies

 

 

What You Get

 

For your generous contribution, we are offering a range of remarkable experiences, from motivational speeches and consultation services (via Skype), to actual vacations at Villa Billa, and other spaces, to discounted excursions and meals here on Providenciales.

CasaArena-Sandcastle Home

CasaArena-Sanddollar Room   

CasaArena-Sandpiper Room

CasaAthena

CasaCara

 

All contributors will receive a copy of my eBook, Advice I Should Have Taken (And Other Things I Think I Have Learnt).

 

The Impact

 

Beyond impacting our family directly, and reaffirming our belief in the benefits of the "sharing economy," your contribution will also help us educate the Turks and Caicos Islanders on the benefits of hosting themselves. Denise and I have been involved in the civic and economic development of Turks and Caicos for many years, and we firmly believe in empowering the native population to activate and monetize their own talents and skills. Plainly stated: by educating more folks about the possibilities and benefits of starting their own small businesses, we will help to raise the standard of living of many Islanders, and there will be more funds from tourism going to locals and not to offshore corporations.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

Even if we do not reach our goal, there is a very good possibility that we will be able to come to an agreement with the owners and in turn realize our dream. In the rare scenario that we are not able to purchase Villa Billa, we will of course honor our commitments to host our contributors on Providenciales. Every contributor will get the full value for their contribution, however the outcome, because it's the least we can do to demonstrate our gratitude.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute you can still help us by spreading the word about this campaign. Indiegogo has some neat tools on site to help with this.

story:
Short Summary

Red Top Technology is focused on bringing the best of technology to underserved markets.

My name is Rick Stump and I am co-founder of Red Top Technology. I grew up in rural America, in Amish country, and saw first-hand how lack of access impedes opportunity. Lack of public transportation; lack of capital; lack of access to technology. These are leading reasons for the fact that the majority of people in America who live in poverty are rural.

After 20+ years in high tech I noticed that many mainstream technology providers largely ignore rural opportunities. There are a number of reasons for this, most benign, but the result is the same - lucrative markets are underserved. This lessens opportunity and impedes growth in these areas, continuing the cycle that creates poverty.

Red Top Technology is focused on being a provider of cutting-edge technology solutions at a competitive price and making sure that the underserved rural markets of Georgia and Alabama have access to those same solutions and prices. This will allow everyone from small businesses to local schools grow and thrive.

What We Need & What You Get

What the money will be used for:

  • Essential infrastructure- the tools we need to reach customers and sell
  • Operating capital - keeping the lights on while we start the process
  • Marketing - letting these rural areas know that they have a solution

If we do not reach our full target? We continue on with what he have! the goal of $60,000 is our good-faith estimate of what we will need to be successful in 90 days - less than that just pushes back the date we become self-sufficient.

What you get:

  • If you make sure we have your contact info, when we are profitable you get your money back. After the first quarter of profitability, we will start paying back everyone who gave to us through this campaign until you get 110% of what you donated to us
  • Once all donors are repaid we will also donate 10% of total raised funds to charity in the name of our donors

The Impact

Here is an example of how access to a value-added reseller can drive growth. 

A man in a town of 2,000 people who is remote from a large metro area may be forced to rely on local retail outlets or online ordering for equipment like laptops and desktops. He will have to spend a great deal of time researching what hardware and software he needs, and might be forced to pay large fees to a company to install the equipment for him. These contribute to the average cost to start a small business in rural areas being $32,000.

  At Red Top Technology we don't just offer lower prices on hardware and software, our staff provides free assistance with identifying solutions and has discounted or free prices on installation and configuration, saving that business owner not just 10%-25% on infrastructure costs but also a great deal of time. Those savings continue year after year as we partner with them to maintain and grow their infrastructure. We can also make them aware of alternative technologies that can give them a competitive advantage or solve problems.

These same benefits extend to rural school districts, town governments, and more. The impact of this would be like adding 3%-5% more money to those schools' and towns' budgets while giving the students access to leading education solutions.

Risks & Challenges

Many rural communities are simply unaware of what a value-added reseller is and what they can do. Marketing and education will be key to raising local awareness.

Our staff will have to be fully engaged and well trained.

We have to make sure that larger, urban clients do not demand the majority of our focus.

We are confident we can overcome this issues because of our tight focus, strong background, and dedication. We are a rural firm ourself, founded in Appalachia, and our own background and location will keep us close to the communities we serve.

story:
Short Summary

This campaign was created to raise funds to own and live on land. As children, we grew up in the mountains and remember how great it was to hike in our own back yard, eat from our own garden, and share stories and laughter around the wood burning stove on cold winter nights.

 

Risks & Challenges

The risk and challenges that come along with meeting this goal are:

  • Before any improvements can be done to the land, we need to own it free and clear so that we'll be listed as the owner and are thus free to do improvement on it.
  • The septic system has to be installed and floor plans approved before we can get a building permit which will allow us to have a temporary residence on the land while we are building our home. So until then, we wont be able to live on the property.

The modular house we are planning to built is in its simplest design and can be constructed in only a couple of weeks. We are not planning anything elaborate. We are also persistent and determined and tracking every dime to make this a reality.

Other Ways You Can Help

Follow us and Share! You can be a support just by wanting to know how we're progressing.

Thank You :)

Follow Our Blog!

Remember to follow our blog as we document our quest to own and live on land.

http://livingonlandinarizona.blogspot.com/

story:
Backstory

I was a creative and craft (in a good sense) child; always drawing, making music, tinkering, making/breaking/putting things back together again. As the years passed, climbing the professional ladder and paying bills left less and less room from doing things that fed my creative self. However, during the last few years, I've been on an active path of seeking to find an outlet for my creativity.

Always in search of the perfect candle, one day while putzing through a home décor store, I stumbled across a candle that was wonderfully scented in a simple and beautiful jar.  In that instant, I had an undeniable moment of inspiration and thought to myself, "you can make a candle like this."   I immediately went home and watched every candle making video I could find, experimented with the different waxes and fragrances for about 4 months and purchased a bunch of candle supplies. In choosing the fragrances, I drew inspiration from the many places around the world where I'd lived or traveled. 

I passed the candles along to friends and family for months and received overwhelmingly positive feedback. I quickly designed the logo, the website, the packaging and finalized the six fragrance profiles currently in the line. Word quickly spread and I found myself fielding orders from people I didn't even know who had received the candles as gifts. 

1st Product Photo Shoot

The name 228 Grant Street Candle Co. pays homage to the home and address of my maternal grandparents in Danville - a place where I spent many hours playing with cousins, helping my grandmother prepare produce for storing or around the table for our treasured Sunday dinners.  My grandmother was the quintessential homemaker who spent countless hours canning, cooking and embodying southern hospitality.  It is from her that I received my love for being in the kitchen and making things that symbolize hospitality and the comforts of home.

228 Grant Street - Home of My Maternal Grandparents

Grandparents, Thurman & Clara Echols


What You Get & How Funds Raised Will Be Used

As a 'thank you' for your generosity and support, I will personally send you handcrafted 228 Grant Candle Co. products to experience in your own home or to give as gifts. Take a peek at the perks section for details.

Your support will enable me to:

  • buy supplies in bulk helping me to keep prices low.
  • secure workshop space where I can fulfill wholesale and online orders from one, centralized location. 
  • move forward with beautiful retail packaging I've designed which will allow 228 Grant Street Candle Co. to be placed in specialty retail stores. alongside some of the top selling luxury candles in the market.
  • exhibit at high profile home and giftware trade shows in High Point, New York and Atlanta.

The Impact

Baltimore is the site of a burgeoning makers, artisan and small business owners community.  Realizing my dream of becoming a maker of handmade goods and starting my own small business has been a surreal and wonderful experience.  I have seen glimpses of where this business can go and I have already reached the point of needing occasional part-time assistance with filling occasional wholesale orders.  As I move into this next phase of hiring part-time help, I will intentionally provide jobs for undeserved and marginalized populations including transgender persons and women impacted by domestic violence.

Risks & Challenges

Every new business has its risks and challenges but production won't be an issue. I have learned through repeated testing and production of these candles how much time and materials are required to fulfill orders. Fulfillment will begin shortly after the project is funded. I have already sourced and allocated the raw materials necessary to fulfill each order.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that it may not be possible for you to financially support, but please take some time to spread the word about this campaign! Social media and word-of-mouth is the key! Tell your friends, family, co-workers, people you love, your hair stylist, your barber, your grocer, your dog-walker, your neighbor, Twitter followers, your Instagram followers, Facebook acquaintances - anything helps! 

The more people know about this, the better shot I have at making this a reality for myself, my customers, my future customers and retail partners.

Thanks so much for taking the time to learn about the campaign!!

Sincerely,

Kendal

story:
Convert you door to a smartdoor

We develop a system that convert your actual door to a smartdoor.

At the Garage door

You could still use your actual system, but now you can open with you phone.

At your home door

Without change your lock, you can add a electric strike lock or a magnetic door lock, or change it to electric lock.

At Work

Don't change your actual access control system, Only add SinLlave access control.

Not at home

Don't worry to open to your friend if he arrive and you're not at home, you can give him a temporally virtual key to access at the time he arrives.

Key under the door mat

Forget leaving the key under the door mat, you can give a temporally virtual key whoever you want, also if you lose your mobile you can delete the access of it from any device or PC through our App or Web site. 

Why Change?

The key was invented 4,000 years ago, now we can do some changes with your help:

  • Open your door wherever you are.
  • Access control log.
  • Your phone send to the door a one use virtual key, that can't be use twice, it’s to prevent hackers can cloning the virtual keys.
  • Use the application in the mobiles that you want with a virtual key by mobile, and remove the access when you want.
  • Give access by date and time.
  • Coexist with another systems. ​

How we do?

With a software for you mobile, tablet, pc and HTML5 device.

With a controller that can convert you actual system on a new system

(Prototype)

We are working to give a better appearance and make it smaller


What We Need & What You Get

We need a massive production to get a better prices, and we can share this with you:

Some perks 

Objetives

  1. $20,000 USD. Design will be improved 

  2. $25,000 USD. We will add Italian language to the application and documentation.

  3. $30,000 USD. We will add French language to the application and documentation.

  4. $40,000 USD. We will add automated opening system, allowing set immediately reach the door, this is released, to allow entry, without operator intervention, you can enabling this option previously in the user settings.

  5. $70,000 USD. We will add NFC (Near field communication) reader connection, in the order to open the door with cards, rings or with nfc mobiles without login.

  6. $100,000 USD. We will add ALPR (Automatic License Plate Recognition), allowing to the controller connect to Onvif cameras (more than 1000 models available). In order that when you arrived to the garage door the controller do an automatic validation to recognize the plate and open the garage.

  7. $150,000 USD. We will add face recognition, allowing to the controler connect to Onvif cameras (more than 1000 models available). In order that when you arrived to the door the controller use the camera to recognize your face and open the door.

​

Timeline


Why us?


Because we have the experience in access control systems that this project needs, also we develop a cloud access control software eClock.com.mx that we release at 2009 with more than 65,000 users, including government, laboratories, factories, etc.

We know about other access control systems, like fingerprint, face, hand, iris, but we believe that's are very invasive so, for this reason, we work in an alternative that improve the security, and now we know that SinLlave is the real option to do that


Risks & Challenges

The number one risk what we have is a delay of our shipping date due to unforeseen problems during the manufacturing process. We have finished most of the engineering work. What we have now is more than just an early prototype; we have already shared our fully functional prototypes with our key manufacturing partners to validate our mass production plans. At this point in the design and manufacturing process, we need to be able to commit to a large enough order for our manufacturing partners to start production.

However, every project carries certain risks. The most common risks are potential delays in tooling, obtaining raw materials, packaging, and shipping. While we feel like we have reduced these variables as much as possible, they can never be completely eliminated.

We are committed to being transparent in the event of unforeseen obstacles, and we will provide regular status updates on our progress.

Open a garage door


Open a door


Coexist with fingerprint


Demo kit - show it to your customers


FAQ's

Can I upgrade my garage system?

Of course, if it’s almost automatized, only you need buy the controller and connect it to your actual garage system, and is ready to enjoy. If it isn't automatized we recommended ask for a technical help to install your motor to open your garage doors.

Can I upgrade my office access control system?

Of course, the two systems can coexist. Allowing open the door with your actual system as well with your mobile.

Can I install SinLlave in the house's door?

Yes, we have several options, it depends how is your door, also we have a kit that include an electric strikes that work with the most common doors, if you have doubt, ask us leave a private message and we will respond you.

What function has the controller's USB?

To add USB NFC (Near field communication) readers, webcam, vehicle barrier demonstration kit and other USB devices to open your door.

Why rj45 (Ethernet port) and WiFi?

We know that is convenience to use WiFi and forget the wire, but also we now can incorporate a professional environments where need a wire, so to cover the two needs we release this version with two options, but we think that in the future we only have a WiFi version.

Do I have to pay rent o similar to use the device?

No, but now we have a charge per additional virtual key, that it depend the time that you need, $6 USD by year for example. 


Do you have videos for the installation?

Now we are working on that. 


I like your proyect

Please share it with your friends, family, coworkers, Facebook, Tweeter, etc.
story_txt:
Convert you door to a smartdoorWe develop a system that convert your actual door to a smartdoor.At the Garage doorYou could still use your actual system, but now you can open with you phone.At your home doorWithout change your lock, you can add
a electric strike lock or a magnetic door lock, or change it to electric
lock.At WorkDon't change your actual access control system, Only add SinLlave access control.Not at homeDon't worry to open to your friend if he arrive and you're not at home, you can give him a temporally virtual key to access at the time he arrives.Key under the door matForget leaving the key under the door mat, you can give a temporally virtual key whoever you want, also if you lose your mobile you can delete the access of it from any device or PC through our App or Web site. Why Change?The key was invented 4,000 years ago, now we can do some changes with your help:

Open your door wherever you are.


Access control log.


Your phone send to the door a one use virtual key, that can't be use twice, it’s to prevent hackers can cloning the virtual keys.


Use the application in the mobiles that you want with a virtual key by mobile, and remove the access when you want.


Give access by date and time.


Coexist with another systems.
​

How we do?With a software for you mobile, tablet, pc and HTML5 device.With a controller that can convert you actual system on a new system(Prototype)We are working to give a better appearance and make it smallerWhat We Need & What You GetWe need a massive production to get a better prices, and we can share this with you:Some perks 
Objetives

$20,000 USD. Design will be improved 
$25,000 USD. We will add Italian language to the application and documentation.
$30,000 USD. We will add French language to the application and documentation.
$40,000 USD. We will add automated opening system, allowing set immediately reach the door, this is released, to allow entry, without operator intervention, you can enabling this option previously in the user settings.
$70,000 USD. We will add NFC (Near field communication) reader connection, in the order to open the door with cards, rings or with nfc mobiles without login.
$100,000 USD. We will add ALPR (Automatic License Plate Recognition), allowing to the controller connect to Onvif cameras (more than 1000 models available). In order that when you arrived to the garage door the controller do an automatic validation to recognize the plate and open the garage.
$150,000 USD. We will add face recognition, allowing to the controler connect to Onvif cameras (more than 1000 models available). In order that when you arrived to the door the controller use the camera to recognize your face and open the door.
​TimelineWhy us?Because we have the experience in access control systems that this project needs, also we develop a cloud access control software eClock.com.mx that we release at 2009 with more than 65,000 users, including government, laboratories, factories, etc.We know about other access control systems, like fingerprint, face, hand, iris, but we believe that's are very invasive so, for this reason, we work in an alternative that improve the security, and now we know that SinLlave is the real option to do thatRisks & ChallengesThe number one risk what we have is a delay of our shipping date
due to unforeseen problems during the manufacturing process. We have finished
most of the engineering work. What we have now is more than just an early
prototype; we have already shared our fully functional prototypes with our key
manufacturing partners to validate our mass production plans. At this point in
the design and manufacturing process, we need to be able to commit to a large
enough order for our manufacturing partners to start production.
However, every project carries certain risks. The most common
risks are potential delays in tooling, obtaining raw materials, packaging, and
shipping. While we feel like we have reduced these variables as much as
possible, they can never be completely eliminated.
We are committed to being transparent in the event of unforeseen
obstacles, and we will provide regular status updates on our progress.Open a garage doorOpen a door

Coexist with fingerprint

story:
** Control Alt Deceit :: Now Available for Purchase **

We had a blast playing / testing / working on Control Alt Deceit. All Indiegogo orders have been fulfilled and we're now looking ahead to distribution.

We can't thank our backers enough for helping us create such a high-quality product. It looks amazing and it's a lot of fun to play. If you wish to purchase a copy for yourself or someone else (Xmas is coming!), you can do so right here.    

 

// // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // // 

 

How it Works

The Year is 1983...

Your friends made a terrible decision — They entered your market. Once every player is assigned an Unfair Advantage card, market domination can begin.

A great business needs a Product, Clients and Marketing; yours is no different. Build your business' value, raise capital, pile up competitive advantages and keep some cash for defense...  

Why stay quiet — Your friends should know who the true King of Silicon Valley is. Once you've bought a sweet helicopter and waterslides for the office, they'll know...

It ain't easy staying on top — The market changes. Your marketing team makes (epic) mistakes. Finances are sometimes hard to balance. Your investors don't always think you're the right person for the job. Tread lightly, it looks easier than it is.

There's no love in business — You'll be able to steal your friends' employees, trash them in the news and blackmail them into giving you the card you need. 

Will you be Beta or VHS? — Don't get "Betamaxed". When your business has everything it needs to go public, it's time to IPO. If you can fend off the competition and stay on top, you'll win.

What's in the Box

Please note: The final numbers may shift slightly depending on stretch goals and final rounds of validation.

Stretch Goals

The more money we raise, the better the game becomes. From Serial Entrepreneur Modes to drinking rules and Collusion game cards, there's a lot of goodies we'd like to add to the game. 

All Amounts USD.

What Players Are Saying

Over 80 hours of playtest completed with players from around the world. Here’s what players wrote after playing the game:

Sacha-Leo Shenkier, Works for a Tech Startup

Daniel Tremblay, Developer for a Tech Company

Andrew Cross, Works for a Tech Startup

Simon Vosgueritchian, Works for a Large Business

Gameplay

Use of Funds

100% of money raised will go towards:

  1. Completing the design work (cards, box and player's guide);
  2. Fulfilling orders;
  3. Making the game better for all players. 

Credits

Game Design: Etienne Garbugli, Aidan Price 
Graphics & Illustrations: Annejulie Painchaud, Olga Urbanowicz
Graphics & Video: François Hosy

A special thanks to our collaborators and 40+ playtesters for the ideas, support and feedback.

Risks and challenges

The game mechanics are fully complete, but we're still working out the exact wording and designs. The main challenges we can see at this point are in balancing the card amounts and gameplay and adjusting the schedule to produce the stretch goals. Thus, we are working to guarantee that the instructions and gameplay are as clear as possible.

Our vision at Bar K is to create a unique, one-of-a-kind community meeting place for dogs, dog lovers and others in Kansas City.  We are planning to locate Bar K on two spectacular acres of undeveloped land on the western edge of Berkley Riverfront Park in downtown Kansas City, partially under the Heart of America Bridge.

Bar K will combine a two-acre, professionally maintained and fully staffed dog park, with a bar/restaurant/coffeehouse where customers can enjoy a drink or a healthy bite to eat.  The dog park will include the following:

•    Separate large and small dog play areas
•    Supervision by trained Bar K staff at all times
•    Dog recreational equipment
•    All-weather seating areas with water, heaters, fans, shade, and shelter
•    Dog washing stations

 

Bar K's bar/restaurant/coffeehouse will be open to the public, but our customers will buy memberships for their dogs to access the park.  This will allow us to track usage of the park, make sure all the pups are appropriately socialized, vaccinated, etc., as well as to generate revenue to support all of the park features like all-weather seating, water stations, landscaping, etc.  We expect that an annual membership will be $149 for the first dog, $25 for each additional dog in the same household.  However, we are offering a discounted membership rate of $100 in this campaign in the "featured" perk.  Some of the other perks come with memberships as well.

Bar K's bar/restaurant/coffeehouse will be designed in a modern/industrial style using repurposed shipping containers, in keeping with the riverfront location.  We will be open for breakfast, lunch and dinner, serving great coffee, healthy food and craft beer, wine and cocktails in a casual, relaxed atmosphere.  We will have a large conference room available for private meetings and occasions.  We’ll also have an event calendar with regular educational speakers, music, a weekly 5K series, “breed nights” and other opportunities for pet lovers to get together.

 

Bar K’s founders, Leib and Dave, have invested $100,000 of their own money in this project, and have obtained an additional loan secured by their personal assets.  But, more capital is needed to build Bar K with all of the features that will make it a truly unique experience for dogs and dog lovers in Kansas City.  Thank you for helping make Bar K a reality!

story:
Hello,

  My name is Monique and I am a licensed cosmetologist and owner of Monique Michelle the Studio located in Winston Salem, North Carolina. Since middle school, I have always loved helping people. I thought that one day I'd be a nurse, like my mother, but after several attempts in college, I changed my major to Special Education. After obtaining that degree, my sister convinced me to attend cosmetology school. I was excited but hesitant because I was discouraged by someone that told me that hairstylist don't make money and that basically I would fail. I pursued on into my dream. I knew exactly how I would play my cards. I would move to Atlanta, GA, get a job in the school system and then work part time as a hairstylist, building my clientele and then reversing my time to make my passion a full time service to others. My last semester in school changed everything and 6 months later I lost my unborn son but soon delivered his twin sister. What an adaptation. My plans changed but not too much. I worked full time in a daycare for 2 years, the last 6 months of that working part time for Regis Corporation. It was time. I told my boss if she moved me to full time, I'd quit my other job. I did just that. I worked as a hairstylist, was promoted to a Salon Manager while being there for 2 years. I grew the company. It was time for a change. I went and worked for JCPenney Salon for 3 1/2 years, only to be blessed even more there. I ranked as number 2 in the salon of 20+ stylist and in the top 5 for the whole district, receiving America's Best award twice and being promoted to master stylist. I worked hard, still do and last April, it was time again. I branched out and decided to booth rent at a salon. It was great. I have a great, diverse clientele and the sky was my limit. I planned on being there until I was tired of doing hair. That changed at the end of the summer, with little to no notice, we received information that our salon building would be sold and that when it was, we would have 90 to leave. I had to think fast. What was I to do? I searched everywhere looking for a location to house my clients. It had to be just right. It had to be the best. I found it but with little monies to fund it. I had to make a choice. I want to be stationary and in a great location. DOWNTOWN!!!  So I signed a lease for a space downtown. All I can think about is how am I going to do this, how will I be able to help people. I have to be able to do both! My own salon is where I will do it!

   This campaign is very important to me because I want to give the best to the best. For those that are less fortunate, I'm here for them too. My plans are to team up with a few local non profit organizations to help with work re-entry. I'm so excited! This is my dream come true. I never made it as a nurse but I'm still helping people be better in life in more ways than one.

   With donations from contributors I will be able to purchase initial equipment and supplies needed in the salon for setup, purchase and provide marketing materials, purchase signage, continuing education, purchase supplies for work re-entry recipients and other community service activities.

 

For the budget of $5000.00

Equipment/Tools:1650

Marketing: $750

Up fitting: $700

Supplies: $1100

Insurance, License, Internet, Magazine: $800

 

Perks to include: First 5 sponsors to contribute $100 or more will receive 50% off of a service.

                     Contributions of $20-$50 will receive a free eyebrow waxing with a service

                                                       $51-$99 will receive a free haircut with a service

                                                       $100 & over will receive a free a free color accent with a service

 

All the funds collected will be used for the better of the business and/or community.

 

Contributors are a big reason why I will be able to build a good fresh foundation to start my business. Considering I am located in the heart of downtown, there will be many that I will be able to help in the community. Free cut and styles for the children in the shelter, location for educational trainings. This business will also allow me to introduce a world of community service to my daughter who participates in our family community events of helping those that are less fortunate. She will be able to set up little projects in the building such as collecting food, school supplies, etc for those less fortunate. Every and any event that is planned, will always welcome our youth to participate, as their opportunity to give back to the community as well.

I know that this a risk of opening my own salon. I have faith that this is a great opportunity for myself and the community. There are times in which business can become slow: winter and summer. I have to plan accordingly and take advantage of that time by marketing and promoting myself. If these challenges do come up, I will have had emergency funds put aside and stay promoting my business. Nothing will be perfect but I'm going to make it as perfect as possible.

 

I know that everyone that reads my story won't be able to contribute but if you would walk in my shoes and pass this information on, that would be a huge help as well. Whether it's passing my information on to someone else or just saying a prayer that my business succeeds, that would be excellent in itself!

story:
What is a THERALIGN® Massage Bar?

The THERALIGN® massage bar is a patent-pending, self-massaging tool designed to relieve fascia pain and restore your ability to move without constriction. In the comfort of your own home, you can release yourself from the pain that restricts your movements and limits your enjoyment of life.

What is fascia?

The fascia is the dense layer of connective tissue that separates and stabilizes the muscles throughout our body. When injured or inflamed, the fascia knots up causing intense pain and restricting our movements.

Because of its fibrous nature, the fascia needs time to soften in order for it to release. When you are in pain, the slightest movement triggers the fight or flight response of the sympathetic nervous system which intensifies your pain. So you seek a method or a tool that will help you end the pain cycle. However, if the treatment itself is too painful, you are not likely to use it often enough or long enough for it to be effective.

THERALIGN®'s small diameter and low clearance design allows you to use it in a comfortable position. You can fully relax as you locate your own trigger points or painful spots. Using time and your body weight, you can bring about a release. It's been said that it's finally a "good pain" when you find and release trigger points while on the THERALIGN® massage bar. You will be amazed at how quickly the THERALIGN® melts your trigger points and relieves your pain. Sometimes, you don't even realize how many trigger points you had until you use the THERALIGN® massage bar! 

How was THERALIGN® started?

The THERALIGN® was co-invented by a physical therapist and an architect. Throughout 25 years of clinical experience, the therapist experienced dissatisfaction with the tools available in the market to give her clients' freedom from pain when they had no immediate access to treatment. The architect and the physical therapist collaborated in the design and production of a product that met the therapy needs and would be a durable and safe. Together, they have designed a self-massaging bar that's unique, effective and affordable. The THERALIGN® will pay for itself in one use.

What is the goal?

We believe that when you are experiencing pain, it limits your capacity to be productive, creative and joyful. Our mission is to have people experience wellness in their bodies. The goal of this campaign is to get the THERALIGN® massage bar to market, locally and then globally.

With your help, we will be able to move forward with our patent process, create a website, buy additional materials to increase the number of THERALIGN® bars produced, as well as package, distribute and sell the product.

We are currently creating the THERALIGN® bar on a small scale in a garage near Boulder, Colorado. The goal for the upcoming year is to find a manufacturer who can produce the THERALIGN® on a commercial scale. To enter a commercial manufacturing phase, our goal is to sell 10,000 units. We believe that with your help, this is possible.

Giving back to the Community:

Our non-profit partner, 101heroes.org will be receiving $1.00 for every bar sold.

101Heroes.org is a non-profit organization who believes in the power of education as a tool to uplift families living in poverty. It's mission is to build learning centers which provide books, computers, and teaching aids to underprivileged families living in rural villages in the Philippines and Africa.

To learn more, please visit: www.101heroes.org

story:
Short Summary

This project is all about creating unique online platforms for polyamorous social networking and dating. 

My first website project for multiple and polyamorous dating, ‘PolyDate.net’ started in 2014, that given me inspiration to come up with a professional dating website PolyDate.me. As of now the website PolyDate.net tops in Google search for the key word 'polydate'. I will be combining PolyDate.net with the new website PolyDate.me. PolyDate.net is designed on open source software and it's free for everyone. The website was success initially but frankly speaking maintenance and promotion is difficult for free services unless you are receiving huge funds. And in free dating and social networking websites many spammers register that will result not only in the increase of fake profiles but also inactive profiles.

The best things you will see in the proposed websites are following:

  • Proximity search (e.g. 50 miles from San Francisco)
  • Match-making based on the profile info
  • Video chatting
  • Private messages
  • Instant messaging
  • Real time notifications
  • Speed-date (future add-on)
  • Blogging
  • Forum
  • Events & Meetups 
  • Groups
  • Advanced spam protection 
What We Need & What You Get

We are targeting an initial fund of $ 5000 for this project to start with. $ 4000 will be for designing and development of the new websites and $ 1000 for ads. Additional funds I hope we will be able to raise after the launch of the websites.

In PolyDate.me everyone of you gets the default 'Free Connect' membership in which you can communicate and network with other members. In addition to free plan there will be a premium plan called 'Open Connect' with nominal fee  where you will be getting the features like Video chatting, Events, Groups, Speed-date etc. The funders will get 1 month to 18 months of memberships with all premium features to get connected in PolyDate.me. 

If you are interested to be a part of my project let me know. This will give you opportunity to participate in design, development and promotion of the website. All funders name will be displayed in the website as sponsors for this project.

If we are able to raise the targeted fund the website beta version would be able to roll out by December 2015. If we are not able to raise a minimum fund, all funds will be refunded to the funders.  

The Impact

Society is dynamic and its values and the way of functioning keep on changing. We can see people are asking the question 'is it wrong to date more than one'? The answer is solely depends on your approach towards life. If you are honest with your partner/s I think we can call multiple dating and polyamorous dating as ethical. In line with this many polyamorous relationships are blooming in the society. It is upto you to decide whether to choose monogamy or polyamory as your relationship style. Polyamory is becoming prominent in the world, where relationships are open and ethical between life partners. 

Other Ways You Can Help

This may be the first time you are reading the term 'polyamory'. This lifestyle may not be acceptable for everyone; as many people were not able to recognize LGBT rights 20 years ago. But polyamory was prevalent in history in the form of polygamy or polygyny etc. In the modern day societies where open relationships are more, polyamory is becoming an alternative way of life.

If you are not ready or able to support my project I request you share this project link with others on social-medias and bring this as a discussion topic. This will give more inputs to this movement and somebody else might be willing to contribute to my project.

I appeal to you to fund my project through Indiegogo. It is one of the leading crowd funding platforms worldwide. I am expecting your support for my project ‘PolyDate.me’ and with your support I can make it happen. You may contact me through Indiegogo or Linkedin or Facebook for more details and clarification about the project. 

About Me: My name is Krishnakumar, a marketing professional, dynamic social worker and website designer. I have been working in educational and non-profit sector for the past 10 years. During this tenure I have been working for Tsunami project in Andaman and Nicobar Islands as Project Coordinator, for free ambulance and medical service project as Senior Executive (Social Marketing and Fundraising) and for Rai Foundation and SAS as Marketing and Sales Manager. You may read my Linkedin profile and get connected with me in the following link https://in.linkedin.com/in/krishnakumarka

Thank you for reading and supporting my project.

story:
Namaste and thank you for taking the time to learn about the Denver Yoga Festival. We are utilizing IndieGoGo in a revolutionary new way by selling Early Bird passes and offering sponsorships to raise money for this community event.

We are presenting the inaugural event August 4-7, 2016 and couldn’t be more excited about the Festival to come. Our greatest mission with the Denver Yoga Festival is to create a commUNITY for everyone who is interested in yoga, mindfulness, and meditation. This festival features asana, kids activities, kirtan, panel discussions, artistic workshops, outdoor adventures, and live music. Bring your entire family because everyone will have fun. We are supporting several non-profits which facilitate yoga for veterans, adaptive yoga for those with disabilities, and scholarship passes for those who can't otherwise afford it. We are counting on you, our yoga community, to help produce the event we all envision for our city.

                 

Denver and the Front Range has a vibrant yoga community and is home to many of the top yoga teachers and yoga companies in the world. We have many small events that highlight our local teachers and set the stage for mini-festivals but we have nothing that puts our city of Denver on display to feature this talent alongside the world’s top traveling teachers. World class presenters will be joining us for this event and we can't wait to share that with you throughout the campaign on our Facebook page.

Three of the top 10 yoga festivals in the world are hosted here in Colorado, and we plan to make sure the Denver Yoga Festival is on this list with them. As the capitol city we boast an historic downtown, bustling nightlife, and mountain playgrounds at our fingertips. More people are discovering Denver as a place of residence and yoga as a path to wellness; it only makes sense to offer a world-class event that brings the yoga community as a whole together in our great city.

                   

We have a committed and experienced team made up of yoga teachers, marketers, local business owners, and consultants to be sure this event has ample support. We anticipate 2500+ visitors to attend our first event which will be taking place in historic downtown at The Oxford Hotel, Union Station, and downtown parks & promenades. The strategic placement of the event in the heart of Denver enables us to give our presenters and out-of-town guests an opportunity to explore the city carefree with a seamless trip from the airport via the light rail. Alongside the bike share program and car services, participants will effortlessly travel around town to venues, shops and eateries, boosting our little city's local economy. 

              

We wanted to give a shoutout to Kindness Yoga for their generous support by allowing us shoot to this video in one of their studios...check them out for excellent classes at http://kindnesscollective.com. Also a special thanks to Tom Martin and Eric Bakst for the beautiful photos and video, as well as Richii Jai, Carrie Varela, Leslie Morgan, Nikki Levine, DesiRae Kraft, and Talle Hogrefe for their talents in making this a reality. My last thank you goes out to the inspiring Mike Matsumura, without which this festival would still just be a conversation instead of a reality. 

With all my heart, I welcome you all to the Denver Yoga Festival. 

Blessings, 

Sarah

story:
Generations of war veterans have been exposed to the prolific use of the helicopter in daily military practice.  The Huey helicopter has long been a ubiquitous icon of security and safe haven. Veterans returning from theaters of conflict have had to silently contend with their war time experiences, once referred to as shell shock, flash backs and most recently Post Traumatic Stress Disorder.  We believe that when Veterans again experience the sights and sounds of a Huey helicopter, it will enable them to let their thoughts and memories unfurl in a positive, cathartic and healing manner.

  Liberty Warbird Association, a 501c (3) non-profit organization is working towards the restoration of  66-16823, a Vietnam era UH-1H "Huey" helicopter.  Your financial contribution will be tax deductible.  Our mission is multi-focused. First, the Association wants to provide combat veterans contending with Post Traumatic Stress Disorder with a link to their past by offering therapeutic re-experience flights.  Second, to enlighten and educate other veterans, pilots, and the general public about the unique and historic role played in combat, by the Huey helicopter.  Lastly, we seek to ensure the legacy of service by both the combat veteran and the aircraft and crews that flew them is not forgotten. 

  Liberty Warbird Association is made up by volunteer ex - military helicopter mechanics, crew chiefs, and pilots.  Many of the volunteers meet twice a week to work together in a coordinated effort to ensure 823 is rigidly inspected to United States Army Aviation formatted phased maintenance protocol.  

  Huey 823 arrived without main rotor blades.  In order to return to the skies, 823 will need several issues corrected.  Time remaining main rotor blades will need to be purchased or donated.  A set of 200 hour time remaining main rotor blades has been located.  However they will need to be purchased for $41,000.00.   The aircraft's left side fuel bladder will need to be replaced with a new bladder. This item will cost close to $9,000.00. An original T53-L-13A turbine engine tear down & inspection will be required to determine if merely an overhaul will be required to meet FAA airworthiness Directives.  Weather an overhaul or a replacement turbine is required the Association is looking at a& 200,000.00 cost.

Liberty Warbird Association is staffed with the mechanical and aviation expertise to return this aircraft and keep it flying for the sake of veterans for years to come. We need your help to help give back to those who have sacrificed so much and continue to do so on a daily basis.

story:
My name is Sacheen Seitcham, I am Nuu Chah Nulth and Coast Salish and my husband Crow is Nuu Chah Nulth. We live in Ahousath British Columbia.  Crow and I have been involved in Indigenous Resistance work for many years. We fight to preserve our land, food, water and way of life so that our children, grandchildren can flourish for many generations to come. The fight against colonial capitalist corporate companies is ongoing as they constantly entice our community with sort-term profits from economic development such as mining and resource extraction with the intention of leaving our Nation with nothing left, to pass down to future generations.

We are currently  table blockading and protecting our wild salmon and our eco -systems from fish farms trying to invade our waters and destroy our natural food supply.

We are in urgent need of funds, supplies and food. Your help is greatly appreciated.

Kleco (Thank You)

Sacheen

story:
ON-DEMAND DELIVERY SERVICES FOR BEER, WINE, LIQUOR & MORE

Everyone knows a great idea when they hear it! Take the case of Drinkos (drinkos.com) which launched its innovative On-Demand Liquor & More Delivery Service on September 13 2014 in Cincinnati, Ohio. The platform was flooded with orders forcing the site to shut down multiple times. While barely keeping up with orders, several media groups including Reuters, Crain’s, The Chicago Tribune, The New York Times and local Cincinnati TV news stations covered the story.


     


Drinkos is the new On-Demand Concierge. Everything that an urban dweller could want, Drinkos will deliver it in less than 60 minutes – whether it’s beer, wine, liquor, food, gifts or cigarettes. From Amstel Light to Zinfandel, Johnny Walker to Stella Artois, Drinkos.com offers a full selection of products sold at local bodegas. No more late night trips to the store, thanks to Drinkos.com – the easy way to restock your beer, wine and spirits. 



So in order to serve you better and successfully expand nationwide, Drinkos is updating their website & mobile app, but there is a lot more work to be done – which is where you come in...Although Drinkos has been fortunate enough to get attention from major investors the company has decided to create a family instead and is asking for your help. 

Drinkos is looking to raise the needed capital through crowd-funding to complete the website and mobile app updates, and hopefully keep 100% of the company. 

...no worries, you still have time to get Drinkos to deliver it.





Drinkos' drivers are you, your neighbor and friends!  It works on the UBER model, where regular people willing to offer their time and vehicles can work independently to deliver for Drinkos.  Have a car?  Need some extra cash?  Think about driving in your local Drinkos delivery area. It’s steady, fun convenient, work.  After all, who doesn’t love the guy who brings beer to the party?

Drinkos contracts with local liquor or convenience stores in each delivery area. By using the service, local store owners will see an indirect increase in their clientele base - boosting sales and revenue.  

While Drinkos is not the solution to drunk driving, it can make a significant contribution by eliminating the need for people to leave a party or poker game for a beer run.




Following its incredibly successful launch in Cincinnati, Drinkos was also able to add Columbus and Dayton, Ohio to the mix. Drinkos is currently planning to expand to most major cities near you and with your Indiegogo contributions this journey will be faster!

Want a Drinkos near you? How about a year worth of deliveries for FREE?

Please contribute to the Indiegogo campaign and help make Drinkos come true!

story:
Covalent brings together awesome people to do awesome things. We host pitch events where diverse groups who might not typically interact are able to identify, form teams around, and work together to solve social problems.

Our goal is to help people build meaningful relationships, develop entrepreneurial skills, believe in themselves and in others, and use that belief to make a difference in their communities. Our process starts with our Pitch Event, then a $1K Challenge (four weeks to raise $1000), and then a Bootcamp run by our curriculum partner, PurposeFuel. 


Our First Pitch Event!

We held our first pitch event on September 10th, and it went better than we could have hoped! While other programs establish complicated barriers to entry like 
applications, scholastic backgrounds, and interviews, we decided to focus on the entrepreneurs and their passions. By removing these stipulations we helped people leap forward with their innovative solutions to hard-to-tackle issues. 

We've Got More To Do!

This was the first real test of our model. We were excited by the turnout, not just the number, but how different each of us was: 2/3 of those pitching were women, 2/3 were people of color and so far 2 teams have joined our $1K Challenge! 


In fact, we're going to do a $1K Challenge ourselves!!! So help us keep our momentum going and bring more budding entrepreneurs from your communities together! Maybe you even have an idea you'd like to get off the ground?


What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $1000 to help continue to bring people together to tackle some of the communities most relevant issues of our time! 
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, the fund will go to bringing more people together for nights like our Pitch Event and Bootcamps! 

The first 5 people to donate $1000 will receive a massively-discounted spot in our Bootcamp, run by our curriculum partner, PurposeFuel. In this Bootcamp, you'll get:

  • 8 collaborative workshop sessions
  • 7 project assignments
  • 1 private coaching

AND learn

  • How to move from idea to action
  • How to pitch your idea to funders
  • How to craft a strong mission and vision statement
  • How to articulate a logic model and theory of change
  • How to write a social venture business plan


The Impact

There's been a lot of talk in entrepreneurship and tech circles about increasing diversity. But one of the things we've found is that diversity doesn't get better just because you fund scholarships and programs (as helpful and necessary as those are!). Diversity happens because underprivileged people have access and support.
Your contributions will help us make entrepreneurship pathways and skills available to people who typically wouldn't access them.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please like us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter, sign up for our newsletter, and tell your friends. 

If you want to share your contact info, offer to help out, or join a team, include your contact info here.

story:
Over here at Quite Simple Hosting, we think big corporate web hosts overcharge for space and give unforgivably terrible customer service.  We want to change that for the creative community by providing... 

COMPLIMENTARY COMMUNITY WEB HOSTING FOR LIFE

That’s right, COMPLIMENTARY COMMUNITY WEB HOSTING FOR LIFE. No asterisks needed or required. You see, space on a server really doesn’t cost that much, so why pay that much? We provide the space and bandwidth a website needs for free. If need be, we'd only ask for help with things like server upgrades or when we need an additional team member for tech support.

At the end of the day, we want to be as transparent as possible. We’d only charge for the work we do, because we believe that’s the way it should be.

What are we doing?

Basically, we’re buying bandwidth and hosting space and giving it, along with excellent customer support, to Portland’s artistic and creative community. Since the servers needed for web hosting are only getting cheaper, we’re aiming to go the opposite route than other site hosters by charging what is actually fair and appropriate to those who need it the most.

How cool is this? 

Beyond just providing space and bandwidth to the Portland creative community, we could potentially change the game on how web hosting is delivered. Instead of the run of the mill, consumption-based model of charging customers whether resources are used or not, Quite Simple Hosting is aiming for a “people first” mode of operation, where customer satisfaction is our endgame.

So... how will customers get help? 

Rather than giving customers a phone number to call only to be put on hold or reach someone unable to help them, our customers will be able to book a convenient time online for us to call them and resolve the issue or concern within 30 minutes. 

Why are we doing this? 

Supporting artistic communities should be a key component in everyone's lives, but especially in a city like Portland that is so rich in creativity. We understand that having a secure and reliable place to share your creativity is pretty important. If something goes wrong, being able to actually get the help you need, in a timely fashion, is pretty darn important, too. We don’t feel like any of this is too much to ask for.

That’s why we want to prove that a people-first approach can still be successful in our digital age. We want to change how web hosts prioritize their interests from viewing customers as just numbers, only being concerned about whether an issue is their "fault" or not, to empowering them to value their clients’ time and projects with a service-first attitude.   

Why should we do this? 

By donating to Quite Simple Hosting, you’re buying into and supporting a community of artists, creatives, businesses, or hobbyists just like yourself and helping them connect with the world. Our goal isn’t about making money, it’s about sustaining and acknowledging the value of our thriving community.

What are our costs? 

Reaching our goal would allow for us to cover the following expenses to get Quite Simple Hosting up and running:

-$995 for the purchase of a virtual private server for 1 year. 

-$150 for initial marketing and advertising.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

In reality, our risks for the project are fairly low. If we don’t reach our goal, we’ll run the server anyway, but we’d have to adjust some of the integral parts of Quite Simple Hosting that make it so awesome. For instance, we may have to implement a separate fee structure or limit the number of artists and creatives we'd be able to serve each year. 

We have total faith in our project and its value to the community, yet we are also realistic thinkers. If for some reason not enough interest is generated over our first year, we will simply secure our customers’ sites with other web hosts and retire the project after two years.

Our Super Stretch Goal

We have an ultimate dream goal of $5,000, which would allow us to become a charity nonprofit. If this happens, we’d be able to remove the need to directly charge artists, creative businesses and other nonprofits for our first 12 months of service. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Help us help you! Donate to us, sign up for our newsletter, like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter. If you’re quite handy, reach out to us with your skills so you can potentially volunteer with us!

Sign-up for updates at http://quitesimplehosting.com 

Like us on Facebook @ https://www.facebook.com/Quite-Simple-Hosting-4...

Tweet us encouragement @ https://twitter.com/QSHosting


We believe in all of you, so donate today and show you believe in us, too!

story:
Short Summary

Off Side Hair Zone was started with the goal of providing the ultimate men's grooming experience. Imagine a place where you can go, relax, put on the game, have a drink and get a shave or haircut followed by a relaxing scalp massage. 

As we approach our 3rd anniversary, our goal is to meet the growing the needs of the modern man. 

Your money will go to support education allowing the stylists to become better at their craft and ultimately giving you a better experience. These days, unisex salons just don't get it. Their prices keep going up but they don't offer what a man truly needs. 

Part of our goal is to be able to offer to our clients 19+ the ultimate in grooming experiences by adding a beverage of your choice. 

1% of all funds raised will go to to support Prostate Cancer Research 


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $1,500 to allow us to continue to be one of the most sought after grooming experiences in Saskatoon. 



Risks & Challenges

If you're not going to be in Saskatoon to claim your perks, please consider the $5 or $20 options. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't in Saskatchewan and still want to help out Off Side Hair Zone, please share this on Facebook, Twitter, a cave wall, park bench, or with your grandfather.

story:
Short Summary

The Vagabus project is a group effort by a loose-knit collection of vagabonds, hobos, hitchhikers, and other adventurous travellers. Our goal is to collectively buy a bus, retrofit it, and drive it on an epic journey from America to Argentina. Along the way, we’ll be meeting all sorts of different people from different walks of life. We’ll be doing volunteer work and community outreach, trying to learn about other cultures and maybe teach a bit about our own way of life. The whole time, we’ll be photographing and documenting it online for you to enjoy!

What We Need 

*We need to refurbish the bus! Right now the bus still has seats -- we want to turn those into bunks. We want to repaint the bus. We want to add a ports-potty to the bus, and attach solar panels so it'll be possible to charge all sorts of devices. To do that we need money!

*We need to pay for the bus! Lovely friends lent us money to buy the vehicle a couple of weeks ago, but they need to be paid back.

*We need gas! Driving down the Pan-American Highway can't (yet) be done on solar power, sadly.

*We need food! Most of the places we're volunteering won't feed us, and we're gonna need to cook in the rough sometimes. Anything that'll help us afford camp food, as well as tools for food prep, will be appreciated.

What You Get

*A big thank you! Once we get this show on the road, we'll give everyone who funds us a big shout-out from the Vagabus twitter account. If you want us to post a custom message with the thank-you, we'll do that too!

*Postcards! Fund us for $8 or more and we'll send you a handwritten postcard from the trip.

*Maps! Fund us for $20 or more and we'll send you a digital map of our route, with plenty of commentary embedded in every location along the way!

*Pictures! Fund us for $50 or more and we'll send you print and digital copies of all the best photos we take along the way.

*Souvenirs! Fund us for $100 and we'll send you a mystery souvenir from somewhere along the way!

*Requests! Fund us for $500 and your souvenir won't be a mystery anymore -- you can ask us for any one thing we might reasonably be expected to find in the Southern United States, Mexico or Central or South America and we'll search for it, find it, pick it up for you, and mail it to you. Item requested should not be illegal to mail, and should not cost more than $100.

*Trips! Fund us for $1000 or more and come on the Vagabus with us!

The Impact

*At most of our stops, we'll be volunteering at farms, gardens, ruins, animal sanctuaries, etc -- basically if it's a place where lots of people can volunteer, we're probably doing something with it. Those of us on the Vagabus have a ton of skills -- construction, computing, experience farming, mechanical know-how, writing, music, art...

*A lot of us are currently homeless! So if you hate homeless people and don't want us in your city, you should fund us, because then we'll be in a different country. If you like homeless people and want us to be happy, you should still fund us because then we'll be in a different country and be doing something cool with our time.

Risks & Challenges

*We're a bunch of hobos, hitchhikers, adventurers, squatters, activists, volunteers and the odd journalist. We've successfully bought a bus, we're currently refurbishing it, but we realize that we're pretty low on respectability credentials right now. That's probably going to dog us during our entire trip.

*E.g. We will not steal your money. We are not going to do drugs on the bus. We are saying these things on Indiegogo right now. Will you believe us?

*We're driving a used vehicle (a bus, no less) down the Pan-American highway, with detours. It's almost inevitable that at some point, our bus will break down in the middle of Central America and there's going to be no air conditioning and it's going to be really hot and sticky and there will probably be snakes. We have mechanics with us so we probably won't be stuck there forever, but that's definitely going to happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

*Tell your friends about our trip!

*Tell other people on Indiegogo about us!

*Spam the word on social media!

*We have a website! It's here! You should take a look and follow our updates as we go on our trip!

story:
Das Hunde-Schwimmbad

Viele Hunde Lieben Schwimmen oder herumtollen im Wasser. Das ist allerdings nicht immer so einfach möglich, da die meisten Flüsse, so auch der Main an dessen Ufer es liegt, viele Gefahren bergen wie Schiffsverkehr und starke Strömungen. Das Hundeschwimmbad ist ein Familienprojekt, um Hunden die Spaß am Herumtollen im Wasser haben, oder etwa unter Gelenk und Muskelproblemen leiden eine Möglichkeit zu bieten sich sicher und sorgenfrei zu Bewegen.

Was machen wir ?

Wir bauen eines der ersten Hundeschwimmbäder Deutschlands. Es gibt drei große Schwimmbecken in unterschiedlichen Höhen für Hunde aller Größen und ein weitläufiges Planschbecken zum Herumtollen.

             

Außerdem haben wir Duschen und Trockenplätze für die Vierbeiner und einen Café Bereich zum Ausruhen und Essen für die Zweibeiner. Die Besitzer können mit Ihrem Liebling vom Beckenrand aus Spaß haben, mit ihm spielen oder ihn einfach beim Schwimmen beobachten.

Hierzu benötigen wir Geld

Das Hunde-Schwimmbad ist die Verwirklichung unseres Traumes der Selbstständigkeit. Vom Entwerfen der einzelnen Teile, über Fertigung der Becken bis hin zum Bau des Café Bereiches wurde alles von Hand mit vereinter Kraft geschafft.

Aber leider sind wir noch nicht fertig. Und damit wir ein Wirklich hochwertiges Erlebnis bieten können brauchen wir noch ein wenig finanzielle Unterstützung. Darum bitten wir Sie uns zu helfen unser Projekt fertig zu stellen. Jeder Betrag den Sie geben hilft uns unser angestrebtes Ziel der Eröffnung bald zu erreichen.

Wir brauchen keinen genauen Betrag, jedoch freuen wir uns über alles was Sie geben. Helfen Sie uns die oben genannte Summe zu erreichen. Wir würden von dem Geld

- die Miete zahlen (1800€ im Monat)

- Baumaterialien kaufen (ca. 4000 € )

- Schwimmbadtechnik (17 500 € )

- Café Zubehör (5000 € )

- Toiletten (3000 € )

- einfach alles was man braucht.

Seien Sie Teil dieses Projektes und Unterstützen Sie uns.

Unser Ziel

Mit unserem Projekt wollen wir Hundehaltern im Sommer und auch im Winter ermöglichen ihren Hund, in sauberem, geheiztem Wasser ohne Sog von Schiffen oder ähnlichem kontrolliert schwimmen zu lassen. Vor allem auch kranke Hunde könnten davon profitieren, da sie bei uns schonend ihre Muskeln aufbauen können. In unserer Halle entsteht ein Ort an dem Menschen mit ihren Tieren andere gleichgesinnte treffen, und mit einander Spaß haben können.

Da wir schon einiges geschafft haben, können Sie sich sehr gerne unsere Fortschritte auf unserer Facebook Seite anschauen und mitverfolgen.

www.facebook.com/hundeschwimmbad


Wieso wir?

Wir sind als Familie schon so weit gekommen, und würden uns freuen wenn Sie uns für den Rest des Weges helfen.

Wer kein Geld für uns hat, den bitten wir darum von unserem Projekt zu erzählen, auf Facebook ein Like für uns da zu lassen oder uns zu besuchen wenn wir fertig sind.

Wir freuen uns über Ihre Unterstützung,

Das Hunde-Schwimmbad Team, Familie Schmidt.

story:
WHO WE ARE

Our organization is SILOAM CHRISTIAN ORPHANAGE, an orphanage in the rural Kenya that help orphans and vulnerable.We started with the 2011 with just 2 orphans and we have grown to 97 orphans 2015.The poverty cycle must be broken! Educaton is the answer.Spiritual AND physical growth can break that poverty and bring hope to these little ones. we look for compassionate people to come along side and join us.Whether in the cities, or in "the bush" (rural), SILOAM ORPHANAGE is committed to go, encouraging and helping with all our resources.

What We Need 

 Things that are on the horizon, things that the Lord is leading us to do:

* Finish building our new building that will house 250 orphans  by 2016 by furnishing,cementing and placing windows at a cost of $1000, * Build a well/borehole that will help get our kids clean safe water,it will also help feed clean water to a society of 1000 people,these will reduce cases of rape among our little girls and also create employment,by paying workmen and purchasing necessary materials needed ,at a cost of  $800* Getting our kids food and shoes as a Christmas pack at a cost of $1200Thank you so much for both your prayers and financial support. May His Will be done

Other Ways You Can Help

 By partnering with us, you will participate in a God-ordained mission to help complete the Great Commission!
